t.schoellhorn wrote:
> Hi,
> 
> I have to create a quite large crawl and want to use the checkpoint-feature to use the restarting capabiltities of heritrix. So I changed the crawler-beans.xml to make automatically checkpoints:
> 
> <!-- CHECKPOINTSERVICE: checkpointing assistance -->
>  <bean id="checkpointService"
>    class="org.archive.crawler.framework.CheckpointService">
>   <property name="checkpointIntervalMinutes" value="120"/>
>   <!-- <property name="checkpointsDir" value="checkpoints"/> -->
>  </bean>

This should be sufficient to enable checkpointing and create automatic 
checkpoints at the configured interval. (I don't see anything missing 
here for initial-setup.)

> Now I have the situation that I had to restart heritrix and want to continue an aborted crawljob. But when building/launching the job an error occurs in the log and I cannot restart the crawl:
> 
> 2010-01-18T01:37:21.267Z SEVERE IllegalStateException: java.io.FileNotFoundException: File '/opt/heritrix-3.0.0/./jobs/500-DS-100114-2/state/cp00034-20100116174133/jdbfiles.manifest' does not exist (in thread '500-DS-100114-2 launchthread')
> 
> 2010-01-18T01:18:44.900Z INFO Job launched
> 
> 2010-01-18T01:18:34.319Z INFO Job instantiated
> 
> (in thread 'org.archive.crawler.frontier.BdbFrontier@...')

How are you specifying the checkpoint to resume? (The two main ways are 
(1) via the drop-down in the web UI, after 'build' and before 'launch'; 
or (2) via a 'Checkpoint' bean inserted to your configuration specifying 
the checkpoint directory.)

> So, probably I am missing something when configuring the Checkpoint-Service. Any ideas what I have to change?

Have any files been moved between the previous run, and the resumption?

Does the file 
'/opt/heritrix-3.0.0/./jobs/500-DS-100114-2/state/cp00034-20100116174133/jdbfiles.manifest' 
seem to exist, and/or does its parent directory exist?

If not, does a "cp00033-" version exist?

Is there any additional info in heritrix_out.log suggesting other errors 
either at the time the checkpoint was written, or the time of 
resumption? (Perhaps the real problem was when the checkpoint was 
written, rather than resumed.)

The Heritrix checkpoint functionality has usually been a bit awkward and 
fragile. The H3 architecture allows checkpoints to occur more rapidly 
than ever before, and deduplication and recrawl features will in the 
future increasingly assume checkpoints are being run, and that resuming 
a checkpointed crawl is even more common than restarting. But, for now 
the automatic handling of files (such as renaming-them-aside in the face 
of resumes) is still crude, and a false-start could potentially foul the 
state of stored checkpoints.

- Gordon @ IA
